item.title: How to complete Eyes on the Prize in Arc Raiders
item.content:encoded: Rewire some solar panels for Tian Wen in the Buried City.

item.title: How to complete After Rain Comes in Arc Raiders
item.content:encoded: Use wires and batteries to repair the solar panels.

item.title: The Denshattack! demo sees you kickflipping, grinding, and joyriding a Ferris wheel into an active volcano on the world's most tubular commute
item.content:encoded: Multi-track drifting is somehow the least wild thing happening, here.

item.title: Samsung is prepping PCIe 6.0 SSDs already but don't expect to get your hands on them without screw-you AI datacentre money
item.content:encoded: 256 TB—yes, terabytes—with double that planned for next year.

item.title: Where to find salt crystals in Disney Dreamlight Valley
item.content:encoded: Add a little bit of seasoning to your dish.

item.title: If you leak or spoil any of Resident Evil Requiem, Platinum's co-founder hopes you 'die a thousand deaths'
item.content:encoded: Hideki Kamiya is posting again, everyone.

item.title: Rumours are swirling once again around Intel ditching its hybrid P-core and E-core chip architectures for a single, 'unified core' design, although it looks like we might have a long wait yet
item.content:encoded: Are my days of typing "XX Performance, XX Efficient" soon to be over? Probably not.

item.title: Reports claim an AWS outage last year was caused by an AI coding tool deciding to 'delete and recreate the environment' from scratch, while Amazon says 'misconfigured access controls' were to blame
item.content:encoded: The vibes may have been off.

item.title: One of my most anticipated indie games finally has a release date, almost 4 years after its initial reveal
item.content:encoded: I just want to be a little lizard, man.

item.title: 'Evo is dead': Major fighting game tournament is now wholly owned by Saudi megaproject Qiddiya, promises 'traditions, values, and identity will remain unchanged'
item.content:encoded: Sure, right.

item.title: World of Warcraft: Midnight's lack of combat addons lets the devs make raids harder without resorting to 'shoot more bullets at you' design, says encounter lead
item.content:encoded: "I think many encounter designers [at Blizzard] have been trying to do that over the years."

item.title: REPO's upcoming cosmetic update is much more than just funny hats and clothes: 'It has become way bigger and way crazier than we anticipated from the start'
item.content:encoded: It might not release for a while though.

item.title: The upcoming Disco Elysium for D&D nerds just dropped a 90-minute supercut of its weirdly beautiful soundtrack
item.content:encoded: Esoteric beats to role/play to.

item.title: Blizzard says 'There's actually millions of people that still play Diablo 3' and those players have the right idea
item.content:encoded: Return to monk.

item.title: A Grok update was apparently delayed because Elon Musk wanted it to be better at answering questions about Baldur's Gate
item.content:encoded: He wants it to be able to play League of Legends as well.

item.title: Five new Steam games you probably missed (February 23, 2026)
item.content:encoded: Sorting through every new game on Steam so you don't have to.

item.title: In defense of Doom (the movie)
item.content:encoded: Eat leaden death, demon. Or alien. Or whatever.

item.title: New Blood CEO Dave Oshry says he's 'always loved GOG' but 'they need enough people to give a s**t, or how long are they even going to be around'
item.content:encoded: "Steam let anybody put anything on there, and then all of a sudden who needed GOG anymore?"

item.title: 'It’s pretty sad and pathetic that a game with difficult content can’t get on the larger marketplaces:' Despite creeping censorship on Steam and Epic, these devs are fighting to make a transgressive stop-motion horror game
item.content:encoded: It's a tough time for weird horror, but Talha and Jack Co won't stop.

item.title: That golf game with orbital death lasers sold 100k copies in two days: 'We made Super Battle Golf together in 4.5 months and are so happy'
item.content:encoded: I always knew golf was missing something.

item.title: 'Critical: Organ failure imminent!': GTA 5's newest survival mod turns an irradiated world against you with shadows of Fallout, Stalker and 28 Days Later
item.content:encoded: Gasp for air in this genuinely terrifying twist on a map so familiar.

item.title: The devs of a promising Slay the Spire-alike are delaying their game to Dodge and Roll away from Slay the Spire 2's launch: 'You'll be playing it, we'll be playing it, everyone will be playing it'
item.content:encoded: "We'd get absolutely crushed."

item.title: Project: Gorgon has recaptured the old-school MMO magic I thought was dead and gone by letting me ask a pig about its mother so hard it dies
item.content:encoded: I have no idea how I'm going to get the Holistic Wellness or Civic Pride skills, but I am so excited to find out.

item.title: Indie publisher alleges TikTok is AI-generating offensive ads using its characters and they can't make it stop: 'Does TikTok want me to be grateful for the mistreatment of my company?'
item.content:encoded: Finji CEO Rebekah Saltsman called out TikTok for "a profound void where common sense and business sense usually reside."

item.title: Debate: Which game series is the most popular to cosplay?
item.content:encoded: Whether it's Genshin, Final Fantasy, or Minecraft, surely some games are more popular than others.

item.title: I only needed 5 songs to know that In Falsus is going to be my go-to rhythm game when I can't get to the arcade
item.content:encoded: Some of my rhythm game GOATs are here.

item.title: Nightdive Studios' Stephen Kick has 8,544 hours in Dota 2, and just clocked his 5,000th win: 'I think it's made me a better leader'
item.content:encoded: The CEO of the remaster specialists guides us through his gaming library.

item.title: This wild Doom 2 mod that blends World War 1 combat with a vicious holy war just unleashed a gnarly prequel campaign where you assault a mountain riddled with heretics
item.content:encoded: Butcher's Summit is a prequel to the ambitious total conversion Trench Foot.

item.title: Fish wrangling management sim Megaquarium is getting a major free update alongside its upcoming DLC: 'I've learned a lot over the years about what makes a good Megaquarium campaign'
item.content:encoded: World of tanks.

item.title: Age verification checks are now in force in the UK because of the Online Safety Act, but with the Discord fallout, it seems like one bad idea after another
item.content:encoded: Data disaster.

item.title: Cities: Skylines 2's new developer celebrates the occasion with a debut patch all about death, making citizens pop their clogs around the clock and removing immortality in easy mode: 'Previously, about 80% of them never died of old age'
item.content:encoded: Fear the reaper.

item.title: Total Chaos, the survival horror based on one of Doom's best mods, is getting a New Game+ mode featuring an Alien: Isolation-style persistent enemy: 'It does not patrol. It does not follow rules. It adapts'
item.content:encoded: "There are no safe zones."

item.title: Well, someone made an Ulfric Stormcloak Big Naturals mod
item.content:encoded: And they call the Imperials "milk-drinkers".

item.title: Roblox responds to LA County lawsuit, the latest of many alleging the game fails to protect children from predators: 'While no system can be perfect, our commitment to safety never ends'
item.content:encoded: The civil suit calls Roblox's online social space "largely unsupervised."

item.title: High flying FPS Ultrakill will finally reach the 8th layer of Hell next week: 'Skip school. Call out sick from work. It's finally happening. And we're not lying'
item.content:encoded: Honest advertising for Fraud.

item.title: This musical RPG is doing important work by letting you beat up music snobs, but I really stuck around for the painful (brilliant) puns
item.content:encoded: I'm easily entertained.

item.title: Avowed was always great, but now that it costs what it should have at launch and nobody's being weird about it online, it's kinda perfect
item.content:encoded: A permanent $20 price cut may be the most transformative patch of all.

item.title: Saints Row 1 designer reckons the series is 'dead,' adding that Embracer 'ghosted' him after a comeback pitch: 'I wish things were different'
item.content:encoded: The Third Street Saints won't go marching in anytime soon.

item.title: Ubisoft made another Avatar game the world has forgotten about, so I opened Pandora’s boxed copy and dropped into the jungle
item.content:encoded: It's as if Apocalypse Now was made in 10 months rather than 10 years.

item.title: To celebrate 2 years of Balatro, creator LocalThunk reflected on dropping out of an engineering program to make games: 'Even if I could warn myself I’m not sure what I could have said to prepare for the insanity'
item.content:encoded: "Thank you to everyone for allowing this terrible student to keep staying up too late."

item.title: You'll need an expansion pack for your brain to get all 20 questions right in our dastardly new DLC quiz
item.content:encoded: How well do you know your downloadable content?

item.title: Helldivers 2's siege of Cyberstan is the greatest galactic campaign the game has seen so far
item.content:encoded: They have the plans for the Death Sta- Wait, I mean the "Star of Peace".

item.title: Interdimensional railway sim Voidtrain gets a patch that expands your inventory, a 50% discount and new DLC that's free until Monday
item.content:encoded: Welcome alien pets aboard your train in Voidtrain: Tour de Void.

item.title: The Logitech Superstrike has allowed me to get excited over some genuinely new PC gaming technology for the first time in what feels like forever
item.content:encoded: It will join the likes of X3D processors, Hall effect keyboards, and OLED monitors.

item.title: Heart of the Machine, the strategy game that lets you be the fun kind of evil AI, leaves early access in March with two possible endings: 'One is focussed on committing ALL the war crimes'
item.content:encoded: Full heart.

item.title: Turn water into goo and yourself into a cloud in this fantasy adventure with 102 million spell combinations: 'The core ethos when it comes to solving puzzles is to do it your way'
item.content:encoded: Learn to spell well in Rhell: Warped World & Troubled Times.

item.title: Age of Empires 2: Definitive Edition gets yet another massive update adding a new line of warships and 'significant changes' to naval mechanics
item.content:encoded: The Last Chieftains DLC is also available now.

item.title: A beginner's guide to installing Stardew Valley mods: SMAPI, Stardrop, and more
item.content:encoded: Set up SMAPI, find your mod folder, and use the Stardrop mod manager.

item.title: If Xbox is 'recommitting' to its console, what does that mean for its recent 'everything is an Xbox' strategy?
item.content:encoded: Divining meaning from the words of Microsoft Gaming's new CEO.

item.title: No layoffs at Xbox as a result of leadership shakeup, new chief content officer Matt Booty says: 'My focus is on supporting the teams and leaders we have in place and creating the conditions for them to do their best work'
item.content:encoded: We'll see how long that lasts.
